com.dlsc.flexgantt.model.dateline

Interface IGranularity<T extends IGranularity>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the object type of the granularity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleGranularity, TimeGranularity

    public interface IGranularity<T extends IGranularity>
    A granularity describes a time unit (e.g. "Hour", "Minute", ...).
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.8 $
    Author:
    Dirk Lemmermann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getName()
      Returns the name of the granularity (e.g.
      String getSingularName()
      Returns the singular name of the granularity (e.g.
      long getStandardDuration()
      Returns the standard duration in milliseconds of the granularity, e.g.
      boolean isDisplayingMarkerType(MarkerType type)
      Determines whether markers of the given type will be shown in the timeline.
      boolean isLarger(T granularity)
      Determines whether the given granularity is larger than the given one.
      boolean isSmaller(T granularity)
      Determines whether the granularity is smaller than the given one.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of the granularity (e.g. "days", "months", ...).
        Returns:
        the name of the granularity
        Since:
        1.0

      • getSingularName

        String getSingularName()
        Returns the singular name of the granularity (e.g. "day" instead of "days").
        Returns:
        the name of the granularity
        Since:
        2.1

      • isSmaller

        boolean isSmaller(T granularity)
        Determines whether the granularity is smaller than the given one. A granularity is smaller if it represents a smaller time unit. Minutes are smaller than hours, seconds are smaller than minutes.
        Parameters:
        granularity - the granularity with which to perform the comparison
        Returns:
        TRUE if the granularity is smaller than the given one
        Since:
        1.0

      • isLarger

        boolean isLarger(T granularity)
        Determines whether the given granularity is larger than the given one. A granularity is larger if it represents a larger time unit. Hours are larger than minutes, days are larger than hours.
        Parameters:
        granularity - the granularity with which to perform the comparison
        Returns:
        TRUE if the granularity is larger than the given one
        Since:
        1.0

      • isDisplayingMarkerType

        boolean isDisplayingMarkerType(MarkerType type)
        Determines whether markers of the given type will be shown in the timeline. It often does not make sense to show markers once a certain granularity (e.g. "decades") gets reached because then douzends of markers will clutter the screen.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of marker to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if markers of the given type shall be displayed in the timeline
        Since:
        1.1

      • getStandardDuration

        long getStandardDuration()
        Returns the standard duration in milliseconds of the granularity, e.g. day = 24 hours * 60 minutes * 60 seconds * 1000;
        Returns:
        the standard duration of one unit of this granularity
        Since:
        2.1
